benchmark_details.name: AutoGeo-100k
benchmark_details.overview: AutoGeo-100k is a large-scale geometric dataset comprising 100,000 high-quality image-text pairs generated automatically for enhancing geometric understanding in multimodal large language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale dataset for training and evaluating multimodal large language models in the domain of geometric reasoning.

data.source: Generated using AutoGeo framework that incorporates an augmented geometry clause system for automating the creation of geometric images.
data.annotation: Automatically generated image descriptions using templates and fine-tuning with language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model output against ground truth descriptions for geometric images.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in these metrics indicate better model performance in understanding and captioning geometric images.
methodology.baseline_results: Models fine-tuned on AutoGeo-100k show significant improvements over zero-shot settings across multiple metrics.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through experiments with well-defined training data volumes and difficulty levels.
